Join Tubi (www.tubi.tv), a division of FOX Technology, a premium streaming service leading the charge in making entertainment accessible to all. Headquartered in San Francisco, Tubi is an ad-supported video-on-demand (AVOD) service with movies and television shows. With over 40,000 titles from every major Hollywood studio, Tubi gives fans of movies and television shows an easy way to discover new content that is available completely free. Tubi's library has something for every member of our diverse audience, and we're committed to building a workforce that reflects that diversity. We're looking for great people who are creative thinkers, self-motivators, and impact-makers looking to help shape the future of streaming. Our services are currently available in the US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Mexico, Costa Rica, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Panama.About the Role:We are looking for a Manager (Data & Product) to support our Business Operations and strategy team.The Business Operations and Strategy team is at the heart of ROI analysis across the company and is the engine of insights and strategic decisions for the CEO, CFO and CSO. The team covers cross functional initiatives and has specific business operations verticals along content, ad sales, business development growth, marketing and international. Business Operations and Strategy also works closely with the Finance team and office of the CEO. You will play a pivotal role in driving high impact decisions by ingesting all drivers of the business, analyzing data and interfacing with key stakeholders across the company. This role requires dedication, great attention to detail, acute IQ and EQ skills and effective communication of final products of the team.The ideal candidate will have advanced skills in SQL, Excel, and Powerpoint.Responsibilities:Provide team leadership on data where you will help define KPIs, source critical data and set up a robust data infrastructure and create road maps for parallel projects with the goal of: creating operational visibility to all aspects of the business, driving ROI-based decision making and performance of the company across all KPIs and initiatives. Which data set should the CEO, CFO/CSO review and why? You will be the owner. This role will work as the liaison between BizOps and Data Science, Business Intelligence, and other Product teams to manage team work streams and build out data infrastructure and reporting. Additionally, the Manager will play an integral role in supporting the Finance organization with weekly, monthly, and quarterly KPI reporting.Ideal candidate will work cross functionally focused on identifying and fulfilling data analysis requests in partnership with a driven and impactful team across several verticals including but not limited to: content, sales, growth, marketing and BD.Content vertical is focused on deep dives into capturing financial performance of specific titles, financial modeling of potential content acquisition deals from dozens of content partners, deep dives into specific content initiatives to identify areas of opportunity for the business. This vertical includes, but is not limited to, identifying drivers of content performance, evaluating drivers of content viewership, optimization around machine learning driven content engines, building out of complex models for varying content deal types, and cost optimization around content deals. Sales vertical is focused on deep dives into ad sales revenue streams of the business, cross sectional views of performance of direct, partner, specific advertisers as well as specific revenue KPIs (cpm, fill, capacity). Ample opportunity to expand into ad sales operations and streamlining opportunities for improvements. Growth vertical is focused on return on investment on user acquisition spend across all channels, tradeoffs of resource allocation, evaluation of strategic opportunities across OTT platforms, and identifying barriers and solutions to scaling. Marketing vertical is focused on tracking what is typically not analytical metrics, defining success and delineating roadmaps for roll out of marketing initiatives in a cost-effective manner. BD vertical is focused on providing ROI analysis for new and existing deals. Partnering with internal teams to provide quantitative perspective and recommendations where appropriate. Additional opportunity to research new areas of expansion.Your background:BS in a technical field, such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field7+ years of of overall professional experience with 4+ years of work experience analyzing large datasets in an analytics or scientific roleProficiency with SQL and querying big data frameworksAdvanced experience with business intelligence tools such as Periscope, Tableau, Looker, etcExperience distilling technical information into business decisions, with a history of driving business outcomesTeam oriented with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, fluid, environmentFlexibility and willingness to pivot to new priorities in a fast-paced environmentAbility to multi-task, drive final products and deliver on tight timelinesPassionate consumer of premium Movies & TVNice to haves:Experience working in Ad Tech, Media/Entertainment, or at a high-growth company Proficiency in Python or RMaster’s degree in statistics, mathematics, or related fieldPursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is listed annually below. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, long term incentive plan, and various benefits, including medical/dental/vision, insurance, a 401(k) plan, paid time off, and other benefits in accordance with applicable plan documents.California$165,000—$180,000 USDTubi is a division of Fox Technology, and the majority of all US-employee benefits are covered by FOX Employee Benefits, summarized here. The following distinctions below outline the differences between the Tubi and FOX benefits:For US-based non-exempt Tubi employees, the FOX Employee Benefits summary accurately captures the Vacation and Sick TimeFor all US-based employees, Tubi offers 12 paid "Tubi Holidays" in addition to the 11 FOX Corporate Company paid holidaysFor all salaried/exempt employees, in lieu of the FOX Vacation policy, Tubi offers a Flexible Time off Policy to manage all personal mattersFor all full-time, regular employees, in lieu of FOX Paid Parental Leave, Tubi offers a generous Parental Leave Program, which allows parents twelve (12) weeks of paid bonding leave within the first year of the birth, adoption, surrogacy or foster placement of a child. This time is 100% paid through a combination of any applicable state, city, and federal leaves and wage-replacement programs in addition to contributions made by TubiFor all full-time, regular employees, Tubi offers a monthly wellness reimbursementTubi is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We are an E-Verify company.
